intro: Ekebergia mildbraedii, commonly known as the Cape tulip, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that resemble tulips. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are pinnately compound, and the flowers are usually bright yellow or orange, appearing in clusters. Ekebergia mildbraedii is well adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
